column4: Ok, I am upgrading from 9.04 to 9.10. Halfway through installation the laptop battery died. When I went to reboot I couldn't. I dropped into the recovery console but it's read only. I tried fsck /dev/sda6 but it didn't return any errors.
It says "One or more of the mounts listed in /etc/fstab cannot yet be mounted" and it's waiting for the uuid...
Can you boot into a LiveCD?
sure.
so, where do I go from there?
Boot from a LiveCD and mount your root partition to /mnt ( if you need any help with that just ask )
ok, now what?
I've mounted it. What's next?
Run "sudo mount -o bind /dev /mnt/dev && sudo mount -o bind /proc /chroot/proc && sudo mount -o bind /sys /mnt/sys && sudo chroot /mnt"
says : "mount: can't find /proc/chroot/proc in /etc/fstab or /etc/mtab"
Be carefull to include all spaces
so "sudo mount -o bind /proc /chroot/proc"
my bad, there was a page break there and I thought it was a continuum
mount: mount point /chroot/proc does not exist
Did you mount your root filesystem to /chroot?
no...
Why did you try to mount to /chroot?
I'm not sure, the only thing I've done on my own is mount it to /mnt . Otherwise I've just typed in the commands you've given me.
Sorry, run "sudo mount -o bind /proc /mnt/proc"
ok, done.
Then "sudo mount -o bind /sys /mnt/sys" then "sudo chroot /mnt" then "apt-get dist-upgrade"
ok, thanks. I assume I just wait for it to finish now?
Yes, and if you get an error about starting a service then follow the directions @ http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/910#Upstart%20jobs%20cannot%20be%20run%20in%20a%20chroot
